lexUnit.name: skilled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having acquired master of or skill in something

sentence.text: The rank and file pointed out that even skilled workshop men earned only 12 million roubles , but administrative heads got 45 million : ` it 's like the old monarchical structure . "
The presidential election of 1952 saw the first large-scale hiring of skilled advertising men to do the politicians ' persuading for them .
Owen had borrowed for the day some skilled police trackers , men who could follow a trail , or a man , even through the crowded streets of Cairo .
Less skilled negotiators are far more likely to match a proposal with a counter proposal .
Skilled negotiators avoid using irritators such as these and keep the emotional temperature down by sticking to the facts .
Skilled negotiators ask at least twice as many questions as the less skilled .
Media is one of the best documented jobs around , but as well as being able to assimilate all these facts and figures , media people need to be good mixers , good talkers and skilled negotiators .
They are becoming increasingly critical to aircraft maintenance operations due to the shortfalls in trained and skilled staff experienced by the aviation world .
When skilled maintenance staff carry out actions , such as fault detection , testing , diagnosing and repair , they do not do so by solving sets of mathematical equations .

As a general rule , the areas wherein the patient 's nursing needs are changing rapidly will require a greater concentration of skilled nursing staff than those where the patient 's health status is stable .
A team of skilled staff is available each weekday to provide advice , education information and treatment to people who require support .

Compared with their less-successful rivals , the best-performing firms had fewer managers , shorter lines of communication and a higher proportion of skilled workers ; they also spent six times more per employee on education and training .
The disparities were perhaps less great among labourers , but skilled workers , such as carpenters , railway employees and miners , often commanded wages three times those of a common labourer .
Skilled munitions workers , in the Amalgamated Society of Engineers ( ASE ) were militant in defence of their own exemption .
The potential for accidents will always exist , so each individual must become skilled at maintaining safety in the face of hazards inherent in the environment .
And added my own selfish after-thought that the whores in Paris were the most skilled in the world , whilst cups of claret were as cheap as water there !
Now Liessa , the most skilled of my children , can barely imagine fifty rather nondescript creatures .
Skilled interrogator : able to extract from your counterparts all they know , especially that which they do n't want you to know .
Only a skilled community interpreter with teaching skills can teach community interpreting .
Being a skilled driver particularly in towns , was part of her job , but the only skill she displayed that evening was in not actually hitting anything .
A skilled historian is able to entwine his inventory material with evidence gathered from a variety of other sources .
Chief Superintendent Alan Jones , head of West Midlands police training , said : ` The majority of our drivers are highly skilled and would doubtless be dismayed by these comments . "
We are fortunate in BP to have a highly skilled and dedicated workforce .
